definition: to form a long queue (idiom)/(of cars) to be bumper to bumper
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc

sentences.english: There could be a long line at the ticket window.
sentences.chinese: 售票窗口可能會大排長龍。

sentences.english: Each day – even during the sweltering summer – thousands of visitors waited in long lines to enter Futurama.
sentences.chinese: 雖然烈日炎炎，但每天都有數千人大排長龍等待參觀。

sentences.english: Similarly, night clubs purposely make patrons wait at the door.
sentences.chinese: 同樣的，夜店也會故意讓常客在門口大排長龍。

sentences.english: Despite the long line of people that were already waiting in front of the shop, Nick lined up.
sentences.chinese: 儘管客人已在店前大排長龍，尼克還是排了隊。

sentences.english: Power shortages remain an almost daily occurrence and long lines greet drivers buying fuel.
sentences.chinese: 電力短缺每日可見，司機爲加油而大排長龍。

sentences.english: Some buildings advise patrons to arrive very early to pick up tickets to avoid long lines.
sentences.chinese: 有的售票處建議客人早些到當地取票，以免大排長龍。

sentences.english: There was a long line of people at the only ticket booth.
sentences.chinese: 票亭只有一個，所以大排長龍。

sentences.english: Long lines at corporate job hiring fairs illustrate just how many Americans are looking for work.
sentences.chinese: 招聘會上大排長龍，凸顯有多少美國人正在找工作。

sentences.english: The traffic was bumper to bumper this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上的交通非常擁擠，汽車大排長龍。

sentences.english: The faithful wait in long lines, their faces daubed with paint.
sentences.chinese: 大排長龍虔誠等待的臉龐上抹着顏料。

definition: to have a full house/to be sold out/no vacancy
filled to capacity (of theater, stadium, gymnasium etc)
lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
front yard as busy as a marketplace (idiom)/a place with many visitors
